title: Question 3
prompt: Which characteristic is caused primarily by genetic inheritance?
description: Within a particular species of an organism, individual characteristics can vary widely. Some of these variations arise from genetic differences and are passed down to subsequent generations. Other variations can be acquired over a lifetime and are not passed down through the generations. Still other variations are a combination of genetic inheritance and acquisition over a lifetime.
feedback: Athleticism, obesity and alcoholism can be both acquired and hereditary. Baldness, however, is entirely hereditary.
